description.narrative: 102/003 By 2020, national and subnational child protection systems have the technical, management and financial capacities to provide high-quality services and protection against violence to girls and boys, including children with disabilities and children in hard-to-reach areas, urban and in emergency and non-emergency situations., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Hiv Prevention, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2020, boys and girls of primary-school age, especially the most disadvantaged, live and are learning equitably in an inclusive, healthy, safe and resilient environment.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 102/003 By 2020, national and subnational child protection systems have the technical, management and financial capacities to provide high-quality services and protection against violence to girls and boys, including children with disabilities and children in hard-to-reach areas, urban and in emergency and non-emergency situations.

description.narrative: Increased awareness under the Children's Act led to formation of 75 district and Upazila Child Welfare Boards. Thirty officials from the judiciary, social welfare and police were trained and the Ministry of Law prepared a plan for multisectoral training on the Children's Act. Sardah Police Academy included training on the Act for recruits. Four-hundred social workers and 60 probation officers were recruited. Case management was conducted for 9,286 children, with 1,688 children receiving CCTs. Advocacy with the Supreme Court led to directives on Birth Registration in Cox ‘s Bazar and release of 121 children arrested by the mobile court. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Proportion of reported cases of children in conflict with law that go through the diversion system and are referred to appropriate community services in selected police stations/probation services
Number of child related laws and policies enacted or revised in compliance with international standards to end violence against children
Number of District and Upazila Child Welfare Boards with Action Plans and clear monitoring guidelines of implementation
Number of brown-bag lunch sessions on VAC from various sectors
Proportion of children affected by AIDS (CABA) in UNICEF supported areas received package of services including psycho-social care
Number of social service workforce including , Union and Urban social workers skilfully conducting early identification and case management of vulnerable and affected children
Proportion of children under case management system in upazila social service in UNICEF selected districts whose case are followed up according to the intervention plan
Costed implementation plan available with at least 10% allocation of budget from line ministries within UNICEF funded activities.

actual.value: 2019:The child protection assessment and mapping in the light of Children Act is available. Advocacy will be continued in 2020 for allocation of budget by government for implementation of children Act 2013.
